reviewText: It was a good movie.  I liked the magic duck.  Rosie is cool because she can talk to the magic duck.  Good movie for kids.  The girls are cute.
Title: Sophia Grace & Rosie: Royal Adventure

reviewText: My seven-year old daughter saw an advertisement for this movie and we ordered it.  Her favorite movie is Frozen, and she also likes some of the Monster High movies, Scooby Doo and the Wild Kratts tv show.  I was pleasantly surprised that there was a story/plot to this movie.  Some of the music was a bit too non-princess like (rap, etc.), but overall, it has a good message and teaches children it's okay to be themselves.  There are many pop culture references that some young ones won't catch (like my daughter), but it's still possible to enjoy the show without prior knowledge.  I preferred the character of Rosie, as did my daughter.  They were both cute kids who did a good job.
summary: Cute movie, even if we didn't know who Sophia Grace and Rosie were before watching it
Title: Sophia Grace & Rosie: Royal Adventure

reviewText: Though they overact in the manner of way too many child actors, Sophia Grace & Rosie still impress with their ability to memorize scenes and play to reaction shots. I mean, they’re still only 11 and eight years old, and they really do an amazing job of just being professionals. But over the past three years it seems that the older cousin has gotten more full of herself and therefore more annoying . . . unless you’re a fan of "Toddlers & Tiaras" or are big fans of Sophia Grace & Rosie because you LIKE their act. Very little girls who are into pink and all things princess will enjoy this movie as well. But for everyone else? It’s like watching a Shirley Temple imitator at a talent contest who tries to act cute, rather than being cute and not knowing it. They’re great in small doses, but the girls make this 75-minute feature feel a lot longer—FamilyHomeTheater.com
summary: For very little girls who love princesses and all things pink, and people who like Toddlers & Tiaras
Title: Sophia Grace & Rosie: Royal Adventure

reviewText: These two little girls are so wholesome and smart!  They try to help a future princess overcome her shyness by helping her find her "inner princess".  I loved the lesson presented to all girls.  We got it for our grand daughter but even Grandpa got a kick out of watching these two cuties sing, dance, and act!  I had seen them on the Ellen show but I had no idea they were so talented in many other areas.  We'll be watching this one over and over, I'm sure!
Title: Sophia Grace & Rosie: Royal Adventure

reviewText: Not good for me, but my granddaughters liked it.
Title: Sophia Grace & Rosie: Royal Adventure

reviewText: not enthused; movie might have been better if voice was up to speed with audio.
summary: movie might have been better if voice was up to speed with audio
Title: Sophia Grace & Rosie: Royal Adventure

reviewText: The movie Sophia Grace & Rosie’s Royal Adventure reminds me of a Cinderella fairy tale.  There are two bratty sisters and a very innocent one named Abigail.  It is similar to the Cinderella story because Abigail has two girls looking out for her as if they are her fairy godmothers. This movie is definitely an exciting royal adventure.The story begins when Sophia Grace and Rosie are sent on a special assignment to meet the princesses of Switzelvania to see which one will be crowned Queen.  However, they loose their guardian and become mistaken as the King’s great grand nieces.  They end up having to teach the King’s daughter, Princess Abigail, the ways of being a real princess.  In the process, they get thrown into a dungeon because the bratty princesses (Abigail’s sisters) don’t want her to become Queen.  However, at least they have their secret weapon.  To find out what that is, you will have to watch the movie.  In the end, everyone gets what they deserve!My favorite part is when the security guard tells the guardian, Phyllis Bunt (Amy Louise Wilson) that she can get out of jail if she reveals her true identity.  She gives a made up name of Dynasty Composition knowing no one believes her real identity anyway.  However, the security guard lies and won't let her out.  Phyllis then jumps the security guard, ties her up and duck tapes her mouth.  I didn’t see that coming!  It is hysterical.All the characters are great, especially Princess Cordilla (Emma Pierson) one of the princesses who makes fun of Abigail.  She has a funny voice and isn’t very smart and plays the part well. The main idea of this movie is that if you believe in yourself, you can make anything happen.I recommend this movie for kids ages 5 through 12.  Specifically, girls will enjoy this movie, as every girl wants to imagine herself as a princess at some point. Therefore, I rate this movie a four out of five “dazzling” stars!  Sophia Grace & Rosie’s Royal Adventure is available now on DVD.Reviewed by Haley P. KIDS FIRST! Film Critic.  For more reviews go to kidsfirst dot org.
summary: Hasn't every little girl imagined herself as a princess? This will take you there.
Title: Sophia Grace & Rosie: Royal Adventure

reviewText: My daughter just LOVES princesses. I take that back; my daughter IS a princess! She dresses like one daily, crown and all! All of her tea parties and doll play involves princesses. When I saw Sophia Grace & Rosie's Royal Adventure; I knew it would interest her but I wasn't sure if it would hold her attention at four years old since it's not a cartoon.Paige was hooked from her first viewing!  She has been watching it over and over and over and over again! I watched it with her and it's a really cute story filled with fun music and dancing that will have you singing and dancing right along.After appearing on the Ellen DeGeneres show and growing in popularity on YouTube with their serious talents; now you can enjoy them in this DVD with your little princess.The story is probably a little old and lost on Paige but the musicality of it all makes up for it and has her performing along with them. It's probably better suited for girls in the 8 and older range but if you have a girl who loves princesses, she will still enjoy the movie.Sophia Grace & Rosie's Royal Adventure is definitely going to be a hit with little girls of the princess obsession age!
Title: Sophia Grace & Rosie: Royal Adventure

reviewText: I thought they would never get around to making a movie with these two super-talented and charming princesses! If you've ever enjoyed Mary-Kate and Ashley movies, you'll love this! These girls have so much personality they practically fly off the screen!In this movie, Sophia Grace and Rosie help a princess to overcome her insecurities, recognize her talents and realize her dreams; all the while contending with and overcoming the obstacles placed in her path by her two competing sisters. It keeps a light touch throughout, with a humorous subplot involving the girls' chaperon who, after many misadventures, realizes a dream of her own.But as entertaining as it is, even the story seems superfluous as it only needs to exist to provide a canvas for Sophia Grace and Rosie to shine. And they do shine, bringing all the fun, humor and talent you've come to expect from these extraordinary ladies. The music is catchy and upbeat, the settings beautiful, and the movie keeps a nice pace from start to finish.I sincerely hope this will be the first in a long line of movies for these girls; they've debuted with a great movie the whole family can enjoy! Try it, you'll enjoy it too!
summary: Finally, a Sophia Grace & Rosie movie!
Title: Sophia Grace & Rosie: Royal Adventure

reviewText: I am a senior citizen and I adore these two little darlings.  I first saw them on Ellen and have been watching them for a few years now.  When I heard they had made a movie I had to buy it.  I have watched it twice and my 92 year old mother has also watched it, so I'm going to say you're never too old to watch a cute G-rated movie that probably was intended for a much younger generation.  You can tell by the way both young ladies present themselves that they were brought up in a well respected and loving home.  Their mommies and daddies should be very proud of them.  They remind me so much of my granddaughter who just turned ten on her birthday who I call Doodlebug.  Sophia Grace and Rosie, I can't wait for Royal Adventure II (smiles)
summary: Excellent Movie to Share; Mother/Daughter, Mother/Daughter/Granddaughter, Grandmother/Granddaughter, Etc.
Title: Sophia Grace & Rosie: Royal Adventure
